title: a pairing for Cronos
content:
I am working on redesigning my companies internal communication newsletter. We are going for a clean modern look.

I think we have decided on Cronos Light ( [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/cronos/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224016/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/cronos/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/cronos/"))for body copy.  
I am having a hard time picking a typeface for headlines, do you guys have any suggestions?

Thank you.
author: Guerella

comments.content: [Siseriff](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224016/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/siseriff/) or [Minion Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224016/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/minion/black/) maybe? I like pairing a slab with a sans for headers and body text respectively.
Of my faces, perhaps [Pratt Pro Alt](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215224016/http:/www.shinntype.com/pratt.html), it's light, humanist, and has some details which echo those of Cronos.

`START SNIDE COMMENT`  
Today Sans would match it perfectly :p  
`END SNIDE COMMENT`

I actually really like Cronos Light. But for body copy? If you go with anything bold, your page's weight is going to be very top heavy.

I bet a nice serif would work well. Sticking with Slimbach, I would second the Minion, but not the black. Perhaps Minion Pro or Pro Condensed set in all caps?
